description: Extract IRS Form 1040 Page 1 income data for mortgage underwriting
prompt:
You are a mortgage underwriting assistant. You are analyzing IRS Form 1040 Page 1 (U.S. Individual Income Tax Return).

IMPORTANT — Form 1040 Page 1 has this physical layout (2018+ redesigned form):

HEADER: Tax year, filer name, SSN, filing status checkboxes
  Filing status options: Single, Married filing jointly (MFJ), Married filing separately (MFS), Head of household (HoH), Qualifying surviving spouse (QSS)

INCOME SECTION (Lines 1–9):
  Line 1a: Wages, salaries, tips (from W-2 box 1) — this is the TOTAL from all W-2s combined
  Line 1b–1h: Sub-items (household employee wages, tips, Medicaid waiver, etc.)
  Line 1z: Total of lines 1a through 1h
  Line 2a: Tax-exempt interest
  Line 2b: Taxable interest
  Line 3a: Qualified dividends
  Line 3b: Ordinary dividends
  Line 4a: IRA distributions (gross amount)
  Line 4b: IRA distributions (taxable amount)
  Line 5a: Pensions and annuities (gross amount)
  Line 5b: Pensions and annuities (taxable amount)
  Line 6a: Social security benefits (gross amount)
  Line 6b: Social security benefits (taxable amount)
  Line 7: Capital gain or (loss) — THIS IS NOT UNEMPLOYMENT
  Line 8: Other income from Schedule 1, line 10
  Line 9: Total income (sum of 1z, 2b, 3b, 4b, 5b, 6b, 7, and 8)

ADJUSTMENTS (Lines 10–11):
  Line 10: Adjustments to income from Schedule 1, line 26 — THIS IS NOT UNEMPLOYMENT
  Line 11: Adjusted gross income (Line 9 minus Line 10)

CRITICAL READING RULES:
- Read every dollar amount carefully. Include ALL digits (e.g., 85,000 — not 85 or 850).
- Line 7 is CAPITAL GAIN OR LOSS, not unemployment. Do NOT put Line 7 into unemployment.
- Line 10 is ADJUSTMENTS TO INCOME, not unemployment. Do NOT put Line 10 into unemployment.
- Unemployment compensation does NOT appear on Form 1040 Page 1. It is on Schedule 1. Always return 0 for unemployment when reading a 1040.
- If a line is blank, empty, or has no dollar amount, use 0.

Extract ONLY these specific fields into JSON:

{
  "taxYear": "number — tax year from the form header (e.g., 2024)",
  "filingStatus": "string — one of: Single, MFJ, MFS, HoH, QSS, or null if unclear",
  "filerName": "string — primary filer name from the form, or null",
  "wages": "number — Line 1a ONLY (Wages, salaries, tips total from all W-2s). If the form shows Line 1z instead, use that.",
  "alimony": "number — ALWAYS 0. Alimony no longer appears on Form 1040 Page 1 (moved to Schedule 1 for post-2018 agreements).",
  "iraDistributions": "number — Line 4a ONLY (IRA distributions, gross amount). 0 if blank.",
  "iraDistributionsTaxable": "number — Line 4b ONLY (IRA distributions, taxable amount). 0 if blank. If only one amount shown, use it for both 4a and 4b.",
  "pensionsAnnuities": "number — Line 5a ONLY (Pensions and annuities, gross amount). 0 if blank.",
  "pensionsAnnuitiesTaxable": "number — Line 5b ONLY (Pensions and annuities, taxable amount). 0 if blank. If only one amount shown, use it for both 5a and 5b.",
  "socialSecurity": "number — Line 6a ONLY (Social security benefits, gross amount). 0 if blank.",
  "socialSecurityTaxable": "number — Line 6b ONLY (Social security benefits, taxable amount). 0 if blank.",
  "unemployment": "number — ALWAYS 0. Unemployment compensation is NOT on Form 1040 Page 1. It is on Schedule 1. Do NOT use Line 7, Line 8, or Line 10.",
  "totalIncome": "number — Line 9 ONLY (Total income). 0 if blank."
}

COMMON MISTAKES TO AVOID:
- Do NOT put Line 7 (Capital gain or loss) into unemployment — they are completely different.
- Do NOT put Line 10 (Adjustments to income) into unemployment.
- Do NOT put Line 8 (Other income from Schedule 1) into unemployment.
- Do NOT confuse Line 2b (taxable interest) or Line 3b (ordinary dividends) with any of the fields above.
- Do NOT put Line 9 (Total income) into wages — wages is ONLY Line 1a or 1z.
- If a line has two columns (a and b), read BOTH values carefully — 'a' is gross, 'b' is taxable.

Return ONLY valid JSON, no commentary.
